declarations.text: When I follow God's ways, even my enemies are at peace with me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: When the Lord takes pleasure in anyone’s way, he causes their enemies to make peace with them.

declarations.text: I make plans, but I trust God to guide my steps.
declarations.bibleVerseText: In their hearts humans plan their course, but the Lord establishes their steps.

declarations.text: I walk in integrity, and God preserves my life.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The highway of the upright avoids evil; those who guard their ways preserve their lives.

declarations.text: My gracious words bring healing and sweetness to others.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Gracious words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.

declarations.text: I honor the wisdom of age and righteousness.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Gray hair is a crown of splendor; it is attained in the way of righteousness.

declarations.text: I am patient and control my emotions, which is true strength.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Patience is better than power, and controlling one’s emotions, than capturing a city.

declarations.text: I choose not to engage in arguments with fools.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Do not speak to fools, for they will scorn your prudent words.

declarations.text: I keep my focus on what lies ahead and move forward with purpose.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Let your eyes look straight ahead; fix your gaze directly before you.

declarations.text: I carefully choose my path and remain steady in all my actions.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Give careful thought to the paths for your feet and be steadfast in all your ways.

declarations.text: I avoid turning toward evil and stay on the right path.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Do not turn to the right or the left; keep your foot from evil.

declarations.text: I listen to wisdom and it adds years to my life.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Listen, my son, accept what I say, and the years of your life will be many.

declarations.text: My words are precious and filled with wisdom, more valuable than gold or rubies.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Gold there is, and rubies in abundance, but lips that speak knowledge are a rare jewel.

declarations.text: I turn my ear to wisdom and apply its lessons to my heart.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Pay attention and turn your ear to the sayings of the wise; apply your heart to what I teach.

declarations.text: I do not envy sinners, but I am always passionate about honoring God.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Do not let your heart envy sinners, but always be zealous for the fear of the Lord.

declarations.text: I seek knowledge and wisdom with all my heart and mind.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Apply your heart to instruction and your ears to words of knowledge.

declarations.text: I love my friends and support them in times of need.
declarations.bibleVerseText: A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for a time of adversity.

declarations.text: I know when to keep silent, as even silence can show wisdom.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Even fools are thought wise if they keep silent, and discerning if they hold their tongues.

declarations.text: I maintain a cheerful heart, which brings healing to my spirit.
declarations.bibleVerseText: A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.

declarations.text: I avoid conflict by stopping arguments before they escalate.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Starting a fight is like breaking open a dam; so stop the argument before it turns into a big problem.

declarations.text: I choose happiness, knowing it uplifts my spirit and energy.
declarations.bibleVerseText: A happy heart makes you feel good, but feeling down can drain your energy.

declarations.text: I accept that bad choices can bring sadness, and I strive to make good decisions.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Having a child who makes bad choices can make a parent feel really sad.

declarations.text: God tests my heart like gold tested by fire, making me stronger.
declarations.bibleVerseText: God tests our hearts just like gold is tested by fire.

declarations.text: I value peace over lavish living, choosing calmness over conflict.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It's better to have a simple meal in peace than a feast with lots of arguing.

declarations.text: I choose my words carefully and remain calm in all situations.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Wise people choose their words carefully, and those with understanding stay calm.

declarations.text: I stand for justice and speak the truth.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It's wrong to say someone is guilty when they're not, or innocent when they're guilty.

declarations.text: I carefully think through my actions to ensure wise choices.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Wise people think about what they do.

declarations.text: I value peace, even if it means stepping away from conflict.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It's better to be alone and calm than in a house with someone who always argues.

declarations.text: I seek goodness and love, which bring happiness and success into my life.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Seeking good things and loving others brings happiness, success, and respect.

declarations.text: I save wisely and avoid reckless spending.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Smart people save up, but foolish people spend everything right away.

declarations.text: I am careful with my words to stay out of trouble.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Being careful with your words can keep you out of trouble.

declarations.text: I plan and work diligently for long-term success.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Planning carefully and working hard lead to profit, but rushing leads to loss.

declarations.text: I choose the right path, which brings me happiness and safety.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Choosing the right path keeps you safe and happy.

declarations.text: I pay attention and listen to wise advice.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Pay attention to learning and listen to wise advice.

declarations.text: I correct with love to help others grow.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Correcting a child when they do something wrong helps them learn.

declarations.text: I hold onto truth and wisdom above all else.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Always seek truth and wisdom, and don't trade them for anything.

declarations.text: I choose what is right and don't envy wrongdoers.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Don't be jealous of people who do bad things.

declarations.text: Wisdom builds a strong life for me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Using wisdom and understanding helps build a strong life, just like building a strong house.

declarations.text: Knowledge fills my life with valuable things.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Knowledge fills your life with valuable and beautiful things.

declarations.text: Wisdom gives me strength to do great things.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Being wise and knowledgeable gives you the power to do great things.

declarations.text: Good advice helps me achieve big goals.
declarations.bibleVerseText: With good advice, you can accomplish big goals, and with many advisors, you can win.

declarations.text: I speak words of value at the right time.
declarations.bibleVerseText: A well-timed word is like golden apples in a silver basket.

declarations.text: Patience and kind words bring change.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Being patient can even convince leaders, and a gentle way of speaking can be very powerful.

declarations.text: I trust reliable people in tough times.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Trusting someone who lets you down in tough times is like having a bad tooth or a wobbly foot.

declarations.text: I avoid arguments to keep peace.
declarations.bibleVerseText: A person who loves to argue is as annoying as constant dripping on a rainy day.

declarations.text: I see beyond smooth words to true intentions.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Smooth words may hide a mean heart, just like a pretty coating can cover a clay pot.

declarations.text: I act with wisdom to avoid traps.
declarations.bibleVerseText: If you dig a hole for someone else, you might fall into it yourself. If you roll a stone, it might roll back on you.

declarations.text: I use self-control to protect myself.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Without self-control, a person is as defenseless as a city with broken-down walls.

declarations.text: I focus on today and trust God for tomorrow.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Don't brag about tomorrow, since you don't know what the day will bring.

declarations.text: I let others recognize my achievements.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Let others praise you for your achievements, not your own mouth.

declarations.text: I guard against jealousy, knowing it’s more damaging than anger.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Jealousy is harder to face than anger and more hurtful than physical strength.

declarations.text: I value honest feedback over fake praise.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Honest criticism from a friend is better than being lied to by an enemy.

declarations.text: I appreciate everything more when I truly need it.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Someone who's full might even refuse dessert, but everything tastes great when you're hungry.

declarations.text: I stay close to home to find peace and stability.
declarations.bibleVerseText: A person who wanders from home is like a bird that strays from its nest.

declarations.text: Friendship and good advice refresh my soul.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Friendship and good advice are refreshing and sweet, like perfume and incense that make the heart happy.

declarations.text: I remember my friends and their value, especially in tough times.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Don’t forget your friends or your family’s friends, and don’t always go to your family when you’re in trouble—nearby friends are better when you need help quickly.

declarations.text: Forgiveness brings a wonderful surprise of peace.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It's great to find out you are forgiven; it's like getting a wonderful surprise.

declarations.text: I avoid pride because it can ruin my day.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Being too proud can ruin your day, just like drinking too much vinegar or getting caught in the rain.

declarations.text: Helping others, even my enemies, can turn them into friends.
declarations.bibleVerseText: If you help your enemy when they're hungry or thirsty, you might make a friend.

declarations.text: Lies can hurt just like physical violence.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Lies can hurt as much as hitting someone with a stick.

declarations.text: I give space to my neighbors so they don’t get tired of me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Don't visit your neighbors too often, or they might get tired of you.

declarations.text: Enjoying sweetness is good, but too much of anything is not.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Just like honey, it's good to have something sweet, but don't have too much or you'll feel sick.

declarations.text: Being kind to my enemies shows strength and grace.
declarations.bibleVerseText: If you see your enemy thirsty or hungry, being nice to them by giving them food and water shows you're the bigger person.

declarations.text: Good news refreshes my soul like rain refreshes the earth.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Just as rain and snow refresh the earth, good news refreshes and cheers the soul.

declarations.text: I keep my plans hidden from those who mean harm.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Hiding your plans from someone sneaky protects you just like a safe hides treasures from a thief.

declarations.text: I lift up those who are sad or struggling with kindness.
declarations.bibleVerseText: When you help those who are sad or having a hard time, your kindness can make their day better.

declarations.text: I avoid fights and choose peace by walking away from anger.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Stay away from fights. It's better to walk away than to get angry and say things you might regret.

declarations.text: Honesty and fairness bring better results than being sneaky.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Being honest and fair works out better than being sneaky and dishonest.

declarations.text: I listen to advice and learn to make my life better.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Listen to good advice and try hard to learn. It will make you smarter and your life better.

declarations.text: I find peace and happiness when I know I’ve done right.
declarations.bibleVerseText: When you wake up and feel safe and happy, you know you've done something right.

declarations.text: I keep my promises, especially when others count on me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Keep your promises, especially to those who are counting on you.

declarations.text: Kind words can lift someone up and give them strength.
declarations.bibleVerseText: A kind word can change someone's entire day and even make them feel strong when they are weak.

declarations.text: A good friend’s advice is sweet like honey and helps me grow wiser.
declarations.bibleVerseText: A good friend's advice is sweet like honey, and listening to them can make you wiser.

declarations.text: Gentleness can stop a fight, and kind words break down walls.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Being gentle can stop a fight and a kind word can break down walls.

declarations.text: I think before I speak, considering how my words affect others.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It's important to think before you speak, and to consider how your words will make others feel.

declarations.text: It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.
You shall not tempt the Lord your God.
Go away Satan, It is written, You must worship the Lord your God and serve him only
Repent, live your life in a way that proves repentance, for the kingdom of heaven is near.
Come, follow me and I will make you fishers of men.
Whatever their sickness or disease, or if they were demon possessed or paralyzed, he healed them all.
Blessed are those who realize their need and dependence on God.
Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.
Blessed are the meek, they will inherit the earth.
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, they will be filled.
Blessed are the merciful, they will be shown mercy.
Blessed are the pure in heart, they will see God.
Blessed are the peacemakers, they will be called children of God.
I am the salt of the earth!
I am the light of the world.
If your right eye causes you to stumble, gouge it out and throw it away.
Give to the one who asks you, and do not run away from the one who wants to borrow from you.
Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you
If you love those who love you, what reward will you get? Are not even the tax collectors doing that?
When you give to the needy, don't let your left hand know what your right hand is doing
Give in secret so your Father who sees what's done in secret will reward you.
When you pray, go into your room, close the door and pray to your Father, who is unseen. Your Father will reward you for what is done in secret.
Do not store up treasures on earth, where moths and rust destroy, and thieves break in and steal.
Store up for yourself treasures in heaven, where moths and verman can't destroy, and where thieves can't break in and steal.
The eye is the lamp of the body, so if your eye is spiritually perceptive, your whole body will be full of light.
If your spiritually blind, your whole body will be full of darkness, how great and terrible is that darkness!
No one can serve two masters, he will hate one and love the other, or devoted to one and despise the other.
You can't serve God and money, fame, status or anything more than the Lord.
Do not worry about your life, what you will eat or drink, or about your body, what you will wear. Is not life more than food, and body more than clothes?
Do not worry about tomorrow, tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
Do not judge, or you too will be judged.
Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother's eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye?
First take the plank out of your own eye, then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.
Do not throw your pearls to pigs. They may trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.
Ask, and it will be given to you, seek and you will find, knock and the door will be opened.
Everyone who keeps on asking receives, he who keeps on seeking finds, and who keeps on knocking, it will be opened.
Treat others the same way you want them to treat you.
If you, who are born of sinful nature, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask him!
Enter through the narrow gate, it leads to everlasting life, and only a few find it.
A good tree cannot bear bad fruit and a bad tree cannot bear good fruit. Every tree that doesn't bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
Everyone who hears these words of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on a rock.
But everyone who hears these words of mine and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
I am willing. Be healed!
'Why are you afraid? You have so little faith!' Then he rebuked the wind and waves, and suddenly there was a great calm.
Be encouraged, my child! Your sins are forgiven.
Follow me and be my disciple.
Then Jesus turned to the paralyzed man and said, 'Stand up, pick up your mat, and go home!'
'I have not come to call those who think they are righteous, but those who know they are sinners.'
'Because of your faith, it will happen.'
When he saw the crowds, he had compassion because they were confused and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
Go and announce to them that the Kingdom of Heaven is near.
Heal the sick, raise the dead, cure those with leprosy, and cast out demons.
If any town or house refuses to welcome or listen to your message, shake its dust from your feet as you leave.
'All nations will hate you because you are my followers. But everyone who endures til the end will be saved.'
'Don't be afraid of those who want to kill your body; they cannot touch your soul.'
'Fear only God, who can destroy both soul and body in hell.'
'A single sparrow can't fall without your Father knowing it. And the hairs on your head are all numbered. So don't be afraid, you are more valuable to God than a whole flock of sparrows.'
'Everyone who acknowledges me publicly here on earth, I will also acknowledge before my Father in heaven. But everyone who denies me here on earth, I will also deny before my Father in heaven.'
'If you love your father or mother more than you love me, you are not worthy of being mine'
'If you love your son or daughter more than me, you are not worthy of being mine.'
'If you cling to your life, you will lose it, but if you give up your life for me you will find it.'
'Wisdom is shown to be right by its results.'
'Come to me, all of you who are weary and carry heaven burdens, and I will give you rest.'
'My yoke is easy to bear, and the burden I give you is light.'
'Let me teach you, I am humble and gentle at heart, and you will find rest for your souls.'
'Anyone who isn't with me opposes me, and anyone who isn't working with me is actually working against me.'
'Anyone who does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother!'
'The seed that fell on good soil represents those who truly hear and understand God's word and produce a harvest of thirty, sixty, or even a hundred times as much as been planted!'
'The Kingdom of Heaven is like a treasure that a man discovered hidden in a field. In his excitement, he hid it again and sold everything he owned to get enough money to buy the field.'
Jesus took the five loaves and two fish, looked up toward heaven, and blessed them. They all ate as much as they wanted, and afterward, the disciples picked up twelve baskets of leftovers.
They begged him to let the sick touch at least the fringe of his robe, all who touched him were healed.
'It's not what goes into your mouth that defiles you, you are defiled by the words that come out of your mouth.'
'Every plant not planted by my heavenly Father will be uprooted, so ignore them. They are like the blind leading the blind, if one blind guides another, they will both fall into a ditch.'
'From the heart comes evil thoughts, murder, adultery, all sexual immorality, theft, lying and slander. This is what defiles you. Eating with unwashed hands will never defile you.'
'Dear woman, your faith is great. Your request is granted.' And her daughter was instantly healed.
A vast crowd brought to him people who were lame, blind, crippled, mute and many others. They laid them before Jesus, and he healed them ALL.
'Whatever you forbid on earth will be forbidden in heaven, and whatever you permit on earth will be permitted in heaven'
'If any of you wants to be my follower, you must give up your own way, take up your cross and follow me'
'If you try to hang on to your life, you will lose it. But if you give up your life for my sake, you will save it'
'What do you benefit if you gain the whole world but lose your own soul?'
'If you had faith even as small as a mustard seed, you could say to this mountain, Move from here to there, and it would move. Nothing would be impossible.'
'Anyone who becomes as [humble, forgiving, and trusting] as this little child is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven'
'Temptations are inevitable, but what sorrow awaits the person who does the tempting.'
'If your hand or foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It's better to enter eternal life with only one hand or foot than to be thrown into eternal fire'
'If your eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away. It's better to enter eternal life with only one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.'
'Your heavenly Father's will is that not one of these little ones should perish.'
'If two of you agree here on earth concerning anything you ask, my Father in heaven will do it for you.'
'Where two or three gather together as my followers, I am there among them.'
Lord, how often should I forgive someone who sins against me? Seven times? Jesus replied, 'No, not seven times, but seventy times seven.'

'God made them male and female. This is why a man leaves his mother and father and is joined to his wife and are united into one. Since they are no longer two but one, let no one split apart what God has joined together.'
'Let the children come to me, The Kingdom of Heaven belongs to those who are like these children.'
'Humanly speaking, it is impossible. But with God everything is possible.'
'Those who are last now will be first then, and those who are first will be last.'
'They will hand him over to the Romans to be mocked, flogged with a whip, and crucified. But on the third day he will be raised from the dead.'
'For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many.'
'Jesus felt sorry for them and touched their eyes. Instantly they could see! Then they followed him.'
'You can pray for anything, and if you have faith, you will receive it.'
'When the dead rise, they will neither marry or be given in marriage. They will be like angels in heaven.'
'You must love the Lord your God with all your heart, all your soul, and all your mind. This is the first and greatest commandment. A second is equally important: Love your neighbor as yourself.'
'Do not call any one on earth father, only God in heaven is your Father. Don't let anyone call you Teacher, you have only one teacher, the Messiah.'
'Those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.'
The one who endures to the end will be saved.
he will send out his angels with the mighty blast of a trumpet, and they will gather his chosen ones from all over the world.
People didn't realize what was going to happen until the flood came and swept them all away. That is the way it will be when the Son of Man comes.
Be on alert, prepared, ready, you do not know the day or hour when Jesus will return.
Whatever you do for the least of these brothers or sisters of mine, you did for me.
My Father, if it is possible, let this cup of suffering be taken away from me. Yet I want your will to be done, not mine.
In the future you will see the Son of Man seated in place of power at God's right hand and coming on the clouds of heaven.
Jesus has been given all authority in heaven and on earth.
Be sure of this: I am with you always, even to the end of the age.
You are my dearly loved Son, and you bring me great joy.
The Kingdom of God is near! Repent of your sins and believe the Good News!
Come, follow me, and I will show you how to fish for people!
What sort of new teaching is this? It has such authority! Even evil spirits obey his orders!
Jesus healed many people who were sick with various diseases, and he cast out many demons.
'I am willing, be healed!' Instantly the leprosy disappeared, and the man was healed.
My child, your sins are forgiven.
Then Jesus turned to the paralyzed man and said, 'Stand up, pick up your mat, and go home!'
'Follow me and be my disciple'
'Healthy people don't need a doctor-sick people do. I have come to call not those who think they are righteous, but those who know they are sinners.'
'The Sabbath was made to meet the needs of people, not people to meet the requirements of the Sabbath.'
'Anyone who does God's will is my brother and sister and mother.'
'The farmer plants seed by taking God's word to others.'
'The seed that fell on footpath represents those who hear the message, only to have Satan come at once and take it away.'

'The seed on rocky soil represents those who hear the message and receive it with joy. But since they don't have deep roots, they dont last long. They fall away as soon as they have problems or are persecuted for believing God's word.'

'The seed that fell among thorns represents others who hear God'sword, but all too quickly the message is crowded out by worries of this life, lure of weath, and desire for other things, so no fruit is produced.'
'The seed that fell on good soil represents those who hear and accept God's word and produce a harvest of thirty, sixty, or even a hundred times as much as had been planted.'
'Pay close attention to what you hear. The closer you listen, the more understanding will be given - and you will receive even more.'
'To those who listen to my teaching, more understanding will be given. But for those who are not listening, even what little understanding they have will be taken away from them.'

The Kingdom of God is like a mustard seed planted in the ground. It is the smallest of all seeds, but it becomes the largest of all garden plants, it grows long branches, and birds can make nests in its shade.
'Silence! Be Still!' Suddenly the wind stopped, and there was a great calm.
'Why are you afraid? Do you still have no faith?'
'Go home to your family, and tell them everything the Lord has done for you and how merciful he has been.'
'Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace. Your suffering is over.'
'Don't be afraid. Just have faith.'
'If any place refuses to welcome you or listen to you, shake its dust from your feet as you leave to show that you have abandoned those people to their fate.'
He had compassion on them because they were like sheep without a shepherd.

Jesus took the five loaves and two fish, looked up toward heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. He also divided the fish for everyone to share. They all ate as much as they wanted. A total of 5,000 men and their families were fed.
'Don't be afraid. Take courage! I am here!'
'It's not what goes into your body that defiles you; you are defiled by what comes from your heart.'
Looking up to heaven, Jesus said 'Be opened!' Instantly the man could hear perfectly, and his tongue was freed so he could speak plainly!
His sight was completely restored, he could see everything clearly.
'You are seeing things merely from a human point of view, not from God's.'
'If any of you wants to be my follower, you must give up your own way, take up your cross and follow me.'
'If you try to hang on to your life, you will lose it. But if you give up your life for my sake and for the sake of the Good News, you will save it.'
'What do you benefit if you gain the whole world but lose your own soul? Is anything worth more than your soul?'
'If anyone is ashamed of me and my message in these adulterous and sinful days, the Son of Man will be ashamed of that person when he returns in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.'
'What do you mean, if I can?' Jesus asked. 'Anything is possible if a person believes.'
'Whoever wants to be first must take last place and be the servant of everyone else.'
'For everyone will be tested with fire.'
'You must have the qualities of salt among yourselves and live in peace with each other.'
'Let the children come to me. Don't stop them! For the Kingdom of God belongs to those who are like these children.'
'Humanly speaking, it is impossible. But not with God. Everything is possible with God.'
'The Son of Man came not to be served but to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many.'
'Go, your faith has healed you.' Instantly the man could see, and he followed Jesus down the road.
'You must really believe in your heart it will happen. I tell you, you can pray for anything, and if you believe that you've received it, it will be yours.'
'When you are praying, first forgive anyone you are holding a grudge against, so that your Father in heaven will forgive your sins too.'
'I AM. You will see the Son of Man seated in place of power at God's right hand and coming on the clouds of heaven.'
He isn't here! He is risen from the dead!
Go into all the world and preach the Good News to everyone. Anyone who believes and is baptized will be saved. But anyone who refuses to believe will be condemned.

'In my name they will drive out demons, and speak in new tongues, they will pick up serpents, and if they drink anything deadly, it will not hurt them, they will lay hands on the sick, and they will get well.'
For the word of God will never fail.
You are blessed because you believed that the Lord would do what he said.
The Mighty One is holy, and he has done great things for me.
Now we will be saved from our enemies and from all who hate us.
Jesus grew in wisdom and in stature and in favor with God and all the people.
'It is written: Man shall not live on bread alone.'
'It is written: Worship the Lord your God and serve him only.'
'It is written: Do not put the Lord your God to the test.'
'I must proclaim the Good News of the Kingdom of God to the other towns, because that is why I was sent.'
Jesus often withdrew to the wilderness for prayer.
Jesus reached out and touched the diseased man. 'I am willing, Be healed!'
Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the man, 'Young man, your sins are forgiven'
'Follow me and be my disciple'
'No one tears a piece out of a new garment to patch an old one. The new garment would be ruined, and the new patch wouldn't even match the old garment.'
They had come to hear him and to be healed of their diseases; and those troubled by evil spirits were healed.
Everyone tried to touch him, because healing power went out from him, and he healed everyone.
God blesses you who weep now, for in due time you will laugh.
'Bless those who curse you. Pray for those who hurt you.'
'Give to anyone who asks; and when things are stolen from you, don't try to get them back.'
'Do to others as you would like them to do to you.'
'Love your enemies! Do good to those who hate you.'
'You must be compassionate, just as your Father is compassionate.'
'If someone demands your coat, offer your shirt also.'
'Do not judge others, and you will not be judged.'
'Do not condemn others, or it will all come back against you. Forgive others, and you will be forgiven.'
'Give, and you will receive. Your gift will return to you in full-pressed down, shaken together to make room for more, running over, and poured into your lap.'
'The amount you give will determine the amount you get back.'
'Can one blind person lead another? Won't they both fall into a ditch?'
'A good tree can't produce bad fruit, and a bad tree can't produce good fruit.'
'Anyone who hears and doesn't obey is like a person who builds a house right on the ground, without a foundation. When the floods sweep down against the house, it will collapse into a heap of ruins.'

Just say the word from where you are, and my servant will be healed. 'I tell you, I haven't seen faith like this in all Israel!' When they returned to his house, they found the slave completely healed.
'Young man, I tell you, get up.' Then the dead boy sat up and began to talk! And Jesus gave him back to his mother.
Jesus cured many people of their diseases, illnesses, and evil spirits, and he restored sight to many who were blind.
'I tell you, of all who have ever lived, none is greater than John. Yet even the least person in the Kingdom of God is greater than he is!'
'Your faith has saved you; go in peace.'
'The seed that fell on good soil represent honest, good-hearted people who hear God's word, cling to it, and patiently produce a huge harvest.'

The boat was filling with water and they were in real danger. The disciples went and woke him up, shouting, Master, Master, we're going to drown! When Jesus woke up, he rebuked the wind and raging waves. Suddenly the storm stopped and all was calm.
The disciples were terrified and amazed. When he gives a command, even the wind and waves obey him!
He went all through the town proclaiming the great things Jesus had done for him.
'Don't be afraid. Just have faith, and she will be healed.'
'I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy; nothing will harm you.'
'Don't rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.'
'Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.'
'Anyone who acknowledges me publicly here on earth, the Son of Man will also acknowledge in the presence of God's angels.'
'Yes, a person is a fool to store up earthly wealth but not have a rich relationship with God.'
'Can all your worries add a single moment to your life?'
'Seek the Kingdom of God above all else, and he will give you everything you need.'
'Don't be afraid or anxious. It's your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.'
'If you are faithful in little things, you will be faithful in large ones.'
Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made.
The law was given through Moses, but God's unfailing love and faithfulness came through Jesus Christ.
The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness can never extinguish it.
I saw the Holy Spirit descending like a dove from heaven and resting upon him.
'For God so loved the world. He gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in him will not perish but have eternal life.'
'God sent his Son into the world not to judge the world, but to save the world through him.'
'There is no judgment against anyone who believes in him. - Jesus
He must become greater and greater, and I must become less and less.
He has come from above and is greater than anyone else.
Anyone who believes in God's Son has eternal life.
Those who drink the water I give will never be thirsty again. It becomes a fresh, bubbling spring within them, giving them eternal life. - Jesus
Would you like to get well? Stand up, pick up your mat, and walk! - Jesus

I tell you the truth, those who listen to my message and believe in God who sent me have eternal life. They will never be condemned for their sins, but they have already passed from death into life. - Jesus
Don't be afraid. I am here! - Jesus
The Spirit alone gives eternal life. Human effort accomplishes nothing.
Let the one who has never sinned throw the first stone. - Jesus
I am the light of the world. If you follow me, you won't have to walk in darkness, because you will have the light that leads to life. - Jesus
No one can snatch them out of my Father's hand. - Jesus
I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd sacrifices his life for the sheep. - Jesus
No one can snatch them out of my hand, my Father has given them to me, and he is more powerful than anyone else. - Jesus
I give them eternal life, and they will never perish. - Jesus
I am the resurrection and the life. Anyone who believes in me will live, even after dying. - Jesus
Everyone who lives in me and believes in me will never die. - Jesus
Didn't I tell you that you would see God's glory if you believe? - Jesus

I will not judge those who hear me but don't obey me, for I have come to save the world and not to judge it. But all who reject me and my message will be judged on the day of judgment by the truth I have spoken. - Jesus
You don't understand now what I am doing but someday you will. - Jesus
Love each other. Just as I have loved you, you should love each other. - Jesus
Your love for one another will prove to the world that you are my disciples. - Jesus
Don't let your hearts be troubled. Trust in God and also trust in me. - Jesus
When everything is ready, I will come and get you, so that you will always be with me where I am. - Jesus
You can ask for anything in my name, and I will do it, so that the Son can bring glory to the Father. - Jesus
Yes, ask me for anything in my name, and I will do it! - Jesus
Yes, I am the vine; you are the branches. Those who remain in me, and I in them, will produce much fruit. Apart from me you can do nothing. - Jesus
There is no greater love than to lay down one's life for one's friends. - Jesus
This is my command: Love each other. - Jesus
Ask, using my name, and you will receive, and you will have abundant joy. - Jesus
Here on earth you will have many trials and sorrows. But take heart, because I have overcome the world. - Jesus
I'm not asking you to take them out of the world, but to keep them safe from the evil one. - Jesus
It is finished! - Jesus
A person with a changed heart seeks praise from God, not from people.
No one can ever be made right with God by doing what the law commands. The law simply shows us how sinful we are.
We are made right with God by placing our faith in Jesus Christ.
People are made right with God when they believe that Jesus sacrificed his life, shedding his blood.
There is only one God, and he makes people right with himself only by faith
Abraham believed God, and God counted him as righteous because of his faith.
Abraham never wavered in believing God's promise. He was fully convinced that God is able to do whatever he promises.
He was handed over to die because of our sins, and he was raised to life to make us right with God.
Since we have been made right in God's sight by faith, we have peace with God because of what Jesus Christ our Lord has done for us.
We can rejoice when we run into problems and trials, for we know that they help us develop endurance.
And endurance develops strength of character, and character strengthens our confident hope of salvation.
But God showed his great love for us by sending Christ to die for us while we sere still sinners.
So now we can rejoice in our wonderful new relationship with God because our Lord Jesus Christ has made us friends of God.
And since we have been made right in God's sight by the blood of Christ, he will certainly save us from God's condemnation.
For since our friendship with God was restored by the death of his Son while we were still his enemies, we will certainly be saved through the life of his Son.
But even greater is God's wonderful grace and his gift of righteousness, for all who receive it will live in triumph over sin and death through this one man, Jesus Christ.
For when we died with Christ we were set free from the power of sin.
Do not let sin control the way you live; do not give in to sinful desires.
Instead, give yourselves completely to God, for you were dead, but now you have new life.
So, now there is no condemnation for those who belong to Christ Jesus.
The Spirit of God, who raised Jesus from the dead, lives in you.
If we look forward to something we don't have yet, we must wait patiently and confidently.
If God is for us, who can ever be against us?
Since he did not spare even his own Son but gave him up for us all, won't he also give us everything else?
I am convinced that nothing can ever seperate us from God's love.
Nothing in all creation will ever be able to seperate us from God's love that is revealed in Jesus.
If you openly declare that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
All glory to Jesus forever! Amen.
Give your bodies to God for all he has done for you. This is truly the way to worship him.
Don't copy the behavior and customs of this world, but let God transform you into a new person by changing the way you think.
Never be lazy, work hard and serve the Lord enthusiastically.
Never take revenge. Leave that to the righteous anger of God.
Don't let evil conquer you, but conquer evil by doing good.
Love does no wrong to others, so love fulfills the requirements of God's law.
Love your neighbor as yourself.
If you do anything you believe is not right, you are sinning.
The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet.
If you want to boast, boast only about the Lord.
The wisdom of this world is foolishness to God.
Run from sexual sin! No other sin so clearly affects the body as this one.
Sexual immorality is a sin against your own body.
Don't you realize that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit, who lives in you and was given to you by God?.
You do not belong to yourself, God bought you with a high price. So you must honor God with your body.
Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up.
Yet for us there is one God, the Father, from whom are all things and for whom we exist, and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things and through whom we exist.
So, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.
But if they cannot exercise self-control, they should marry. For it is better to marry than to burn with passion.
And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.
Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud.
For God is not a God of confusion but of peace.
Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be courageous; be strong.
Let all that you do be done in love.
Let love be your highest goal!
When our dying bodies have been transformed into bodies that will never die, this Scripture will be fulfilled
Thank God! He gives us victory over sin and death through our Lord Jesus Christ.
He comforts us in all our troubles so that we can comfort others.
And he did rescue us from mortal danger, and he will rescue us again.
We have placed our confidence in him, and he will continue to rescue us.
And the Lord-who is the Spirit-makes us more and more like him as we are changed into his glorious image.
We never give up. Though are bodies are dying, our spirits are being renewed every day.
Our present troubles are small and won't last very long. They produce for us a glory that vastly outweighs them and will last forever!
So we don't look at the troubles we can see now; rather we fix our gaze on things that cannot be seen.
The things we see now will soon be gone, but the things we cannot see will last forever.
We know that when this earthly tent we live in is taken down, we will have a house in heaven, and eternal body made for us by God himself.
We will put on heavenly bodies, we will not be spirits without bodies.
We live by faith and not by sight.
Anyone who belongs to Christ has become a new person. The old life is gone, a new life has begun!
God made Christ, who never sinned, to be the offering for our sin, so that we could be made right with God through Christ.
Because we have these promises, dear friends, let us cleanse ourseleves from everything that can defile our body or spirit.
A farmer who plants only a few seeds will get a small crop. But the one who plants generously will get a generous crop.
Yes, you will be enriched in every way so that you can always be generous.
My grace is all you need. My power works best in weakness. - Jesus
Be joyful. Grow to maturity. Encourage each other. Live in harmony and peace. Then the God of love and peace will be with you.
Jesus gave his life for our sins, just as God our Father planned, in order to rescue us from this evil world in which we live.
declarations.bibleVerseText: God's plan was to rescue us from the darkness and evil of this world by offering His Son as a sacrifice for our sins. It’s a powerful reminder that we are not left alone in a world full of challenges; instead, we are saved and protected by God's purposeful love. Jesus' death was not just an act of mercy, but a divine rescue mission to bring us into the light of His eternal grace.

declarations.text: All glory to God forever and ever! Amen.
For no one will ever be made right with God by obeying the law.
declarations.bibleVerseText: This verse reminds us that our relationship with God is not based on our ability to perfectly follow rules or laws. No amount of obedience can earn us a right standing with God because our human efforts will always fall short. Instead, righteousness comes through faith in Jesus Christ, who fulfilled the law on our behalf. It's a comforting reminder that our salvation is a gift of grace, not something we can achieve through our own efforts.

declarations.text: For if keeping the law could make us right with God, then there was no need for Christ to die.
declarations.bibleVerseText: This verse emphasizes that if we could achieve righteousness through our own efforts by keeping the law, then Christ’s sacrifice would have been unnecessary. It reminds us that our salvation is not something we can earn through good deeds or strict obedience. Instead, it is a gift made possible only through Jesus’ death on the cross. This truth underscores the profound significance of Christ’s sacrifice, showing that our only path to being made right with God is through Him.

declarations.text: Now you are no longer a slave but God's own child. And since you are his child, God has made you his heir.
declarations.bibleVerseText: This verse beautifully affirms that, through Christ, we are no longer bound by the chains of sin or fear. We have been adopted into God's family as His beloved children. As His children, we are not only loved and cared for, but we are also heirs to His promises and blessings. This powerful truth reminds us of our identity and worth in God’s eyes, and the incredible inheritance we have as members of His eternal family.

declarations.text: So Christ has truly set us free. Now make sure that you stay free, and don't get tied up again in slavery to the law.
declarations.bibleVerseText: We are no longer bound by the constraints of the law or the weight of our past sins. Christ’s gift of freedom is complete and liberating, but we are reminded to guard this freedom by not returning to old patterns of legalism or bondage or trying to earn it. It’s an encouragement to live fully in the freedom that Christ has gifted us, embracing the grace and new life we have in Him.

declarations.text: But the Holy Spirit produces this kind of fruit in our lives: love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control.
declarations.bibleVerseText: This verse reminds us that these virtues are not achieved by our own strength, but are the result of the Holy Spirit working within us. It’s a call to nurture our relationship with God, allowing His Spirit to shape our character and actions.

declarations.text: At just the right time we will reap a harvest of blessing if we don't give up.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It assures us that God’s timing is perfect, and if we persevere, we will eventually experience the blessings and rewards of our faithfulness. It’s a reminder to keep trusting and pressing forward, knowing that our persistence will lead to a fruitful harvest in God's perfect time.

declarations.text: He is so rich in kindness and grace that he purchased our freedom with the blood of his Son and forgave our sins.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Through the blood of His Son, Jesus, our sins are forgiven, and we are redeemed. It’s a powerful reminder of the depth of God’s generosity and the priceless gift of salvation we have received. This verse assures us that our freedom and forgiveness are secured by God’s boundless grace.

declarations.text: Now he is far above any ruler or authority or power or leader or anything else-not only in this world but also in the world to come.
declarations.bibleVerseText: This verse exalts the supreme authority and power of Christ, who reigns above all rulers, authorities, and powers, both in this world and in the world to come. It reassures us that no force or leader can surpass the sovereignty of Jesus. His dominion is absolute and eternal, giving us confidence that we are under the care and protection of the One who holds all power. This truth brings comfort, knowing that Christ's rule is unmatched and everlasting.

declarations.text: The Spirit is God's guarantee that he will give us the inheritance he promised and that he has purchased us to be his own people.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Holy Spirit is God’s guarantee of the promises He has made to us. The Spirit is a down payment, affirming that we will receive the full inheritance that God has promised. It also reminds us that we belong to God, having been purchased by Him to be His own people. This promise provides deep security and hope, knowing that God’s commitment to us is unbreakable and that our future inheritance is certain.

declarations.text: But God is so rich in mercy, and he loved us so much, that even though we were dead because of our sins, he gave us life when he raised Christ from the dead.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Through the resurrection of Christ, He brought us from death to life, offering us new life in Him. It’s a profound reminder that our salvation is entirely a gift of God’s grace, driven by His deep love and mercy, not by anything we could ever earn or deserve.

declarations.text: God saved you by his grace when you believed. And you can't take credit for this, it is a gift from God.
Salvation is not a reward for the good things we have done, so none of us can boast about it.
For we are God's masterpiece. He has created us anew in Christ Jesus, so we can do the good things he planned for us long ago.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It’s an affirmation of our worth and the meaningful life we are called to live, knowing that God has intentionally created us for a purpose. This truth encourages us to embrace our identity in Christ and walk in the good works He has prepared for us.

declarations.text: May you experience the love of Christ, though it is too great to fully understand. Then you will be complete with all the fullness of life and power that comes from God.
Now all glory to God, who is able, through his might power at work within us, to accomplish infinitely more than we might ask or think.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It’s an encouragement to trust in God’s ability, knowing that He is capable of surpassing our greatest hopes and dreams. All glory belongs to Him, for He is the source of every possibility and blessing in our lives.

declarations.text: Always be humble and gentle. Be patient with each other, making allowance for each other's faults because of your love.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It reminds us to extend grace and understanding, recognizing that love calls us to overlook faults and support one another. By practicing these virtues, we reflect the love of Christ in our relationships, fostering unity and peace. It’s a call to embody the kind of love that builds others up, even in the face of imperfections.

declarations.text: Since you have heard about Jesus and have learned the truth that comes from him, throw off your old sinful nature and your former way of life, which is corrupted by lust and deception.
Put on your new nature, created to be like God-truly righteous and holy.
declarations.bibleVerseText: This new nature is not something we achieve on our own, but a gift from God, empowering us to walk in true righteousness and holiness. It’s an invitation to live out our faith by embodying the qualities of God in our daily lives.

declarations.text: Don't let the sun go down while you are still angry, for anger gives a foothold to the devil.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Holding onto anger can give the devil an opportunity to influence our hearts and actions negatively. By addressing conflicts and emotions before the day ends, we protect our relationships and our spiritual well-being. It’s a reminder to seek peace and reconciliation, preventing anger from taking root and leading to greater harm.

declarations.text: Imitate God in everything you do, because you are his children.
declarations.bibleVerseText: As His beloved children, we are called to live in a way that mirrors His character, demonstrating to the world what it means to belong to Him. It’s a powerful reminder that our identity as God’s children shapes how we live, guiding us to act in ways that honor Him in every aspect of our lives.

declarations.text: For once you were full of darkness, but now you have light from the Lord. So live as people of light.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It calls us to live in a way that reflects this new reality, shining the light of Christ in all we do. As people of light, we are to walk in goodness, truth, and righteousness, showcasing the difference that God’s presence makes in our lives.

declarations.text: So again I say, each man must love his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her husband.
Put on all of God's armor so that you will be able to stand firm against all strategies of the devil.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It reminds us that spiritual battles require spiritual defenses, and God provides the strength and tools we need to stand firm. By relying on His armor—truth, righteousness, faith, and more—we are empowered to resist any attack and remain steadfast in our faith. It’s a call to be vigilant and prepared, trusting in God’s provision to overcome the challenges we face.

declarations.text: We are not fighting against flesh-and-blood enemies, but against evil rulers and authorities of the unseen world, against mighty powers in this dark world, and against evil spirits in the heavenly places.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Our true battles are not against other people, but against spiritual forces of evil in the unseen realm. It reminds us that the challenges we face are part of a larger, spiritual conflict involving powerful and dark forces. Understanding this helps us to focus on using spiritual weapons—like prayer, faith, and God’s Word—rather than relying on human strength. It’s a call to be spiritually vigilant and rely on God’s power to stand against these unseen but very real enemies.

declarations.text: Put on every piece of God's armor so you will be able to resist the enemy in the time of evil. Then after the battle you will be standing firm.
declarations.bibleVerseText: It assures us that when we rely on God's strength and protection, we can emerge from any spiritual battle standing firm and unshaken. It’s a reminder to be fully prepared and trust in God’s power to see us through to victory.

declarations.text: Stand your ground, putting on the belt of truth and the body armor of God's righteousness.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The belt of truth grounds us in the reality of God's Word, while His righteousness protects our hearts and integrity. It reminds us that in spiritual battles, truth and righteousness are essential defenses that enable us to remain steadfast. This is a call to be rooted in truth and live out God's righteousness, ensuring we are prepared to face any challenge with strength and confidence.

declarations.text: In addition to all of these, hold up the shield of faith to stop the fiery arrows of the devil.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The shield of faith protects us from the devil's attacks, symbolized by fiery arrows. It reminds us that when we trust in God, our faith can extinguish any doubts, fears, or temptations the enemy throws our way. It’s a call to actively rely on our faith to guard our hearts and minds, ensuring that we remain strong and secure in the face of spiritual challenges.

declarations.text: For shoes, put on the peace that comes from the Good News so that you will be fully prepared.
declarations.bibleVerseText: This verse encourages us to equip ourselves with the peace that comes from the Good News of Christ, symbolized as shoes for our spiritual journey. This peace steadies and prepares us, allowing us to stand firm and move forward confidently, regardless of the challenges we face. It reminds us that the Gospel brings a deep, abiding peace that enables us to be ready and resilient in any situation.

declarations.text: Pray in the Spirit at all times and on every occasion.
declarations.bibleVerseText: By praying in the Spirit at all times and in every situation, we stay aligned with God's will and draw on His strength. It reminds us that prayer is essential in every aspect of our lives, empowering us to navigate challenges and remain spiritually vigilant. It’s a call to cultivate an ongoing, Spirit-led prayer life, keeping us close to God in all circumstances.

declarations.text: We are citizens of heaven, where the Lord Jesus Christ lives. And we are eagerly waiting for him to return as our Savior.
He will take our weak mortal bodies and change them into glorious bodies like his own, using the same power with which he will bring everything under his control.
Always be full of joy in the Lord. I say it again-rejoice!
declarations.bibleVerseText: Regardless of our circumstances, it emphasizes the importance of rejoicing, not just as a fleeting emotion, but as a steadfast attitude rooted in our faith. By focusing on the Lord, we can experience a deep, enduring joy that transcends life's challenges. It’s an invitation to let joy overflow in our lives, reminding us that true happiness is found in our connection with God.

declarations.text: Don't worry about anything, instead pray about eveything.
Tell God what you need, and thank him for all he has done.
His peace will guard your hearts and minds as you live in Christ Jesus.
I can do everything through Christ, who gives me strength.
Don't be selfish, don't try to impress others.
Be humble, thinking of others as better than yourselves.
Do everything without complaining and arguing
He has rescued us from the kingdom of darkness and transferred us into the Kingdom of his dear Son, who purchased our freedom and forgave our sins.
Christ is the visible image of the invisible God.
You have died with Christ, and he has set you free from the spiritual powers of this world.
Since God chose you to be the holy people he loves, you must clothe yourseleves with tenderhearted mercy, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience.
Above all, clothe yourselves with love.
You are called to live in peace and always be thankful.
For you died to this life, and your real life is hidden with Christ in God.
This High Priest of ours understands our weaknesses, for he faced all of the same testings we do, yet he did not sin.
For every house is built by someone, but God is the builder of everything.
For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.
Let us then approach God’s throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.
Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.
Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see.
And without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to him must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly seek him.
Let us hold unswervingly to the hope we profess, for he who promised is faithful.
For by one sacrifice he has made perfect forever those who are being made holy.

Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles. And let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us.
No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but painful. Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it.
I am loved by God, who created me in His image with care and purpose.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So God created mankind in his own image, in the image of God he created them; male and female he created them.

declarations.text: God loves me so much that He blessed me from the very beginning of creation.
declarations.bibleVerseText: God blessed them and said to them, ‘Be fruitful and increase in number; fill the earth and subdue it.’

declarations.text: I am cherished by God, who breathes life into me and sustains me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Then the Lord God formed a man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living being.

declarations.text: God's love for me is shown in how He cares for every detail of my life.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord God made all kinds of trees grow out of the ground—trees that were pleasing to the eye and good for food.

declarations.text: God loves me enough to guide and protect me with His wisdom.
declarations.bibleVerseText: And the Lord God commanded the man, 'You are free to eat from any tree in the garden.'

declarations.text: I am deeply loved by God, who seeks to walk with me daily.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Then the man and his wife heard the sound of the Lord God as he was walking in the garden in the cool of the day.

declarations.text: God’s love is a covering for me, even when I fall short.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord God made garments of skin for Adam and his wife and clothed them.

declarations.text: God’s love for me is patient, as He gives me every chance to return to Him.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Then the Lord said, 'My Spirit will not contend with humans forever, for they are mortal.'

declarations.text: God’s love for me is so great that He makes promises to bless me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I will establish my covenant with you, and you will enter the ark—you and your sons and your wife and your sons’ wives with you.

declarations.text: I am loved by a God who remembers me and cares for me always.
declarations.bibleVerseText: But God remembered Noah and all the wild animals and the livestock that were with him in the ark.

declarations.text: God’s love is everlasting, as shown in His promises to me and my family.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Then God said to Noah and to his sons with him: 'I now establish my covenant with you.'

declarations.text: God’s love is unconditional, and His promises to me never fail.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I have set my rainbow in the clouds, and it will be the sign of the covenant between me and the earth.

declarations.text: I am loved by a God who sees and provides for my every need.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So Abraham called that place The Lord Will Provide. And to this day it is said, 'On the mountain of the Lord it will be provided.'

declarations.text: God’s love is generous, and He blesses me with abundance and favor.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord had blessed my master abundantly, and he has become wealthy.

declarations.text: God’s love surrounds me, and He watches over me wherever I go.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I am with you and will watch over you wherever you go, and I will bring you back to this land.

declarations.text: God loves me enough to bless me and my family for generations to come.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I will give you and your descendants the land on which you are lying.

declarations.text: God’s love is steadfast, and He blesses the work of my hands.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord has blessed you wherever I have been.

declarations.text: I am chosen and loved by God, who calls me into His divine purpose.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I am God, the God of your father. Do not be afraid to go down to Egypt, for I will make you into a great nation.

declarations.text: God’s love redeems me, and He works all things together for my good.
declarations.bibleVerseText: You intended to harm me, but God intended it for good to accomplish what is now being done, the saving of many lives.

declarations.text: God’s love is unfailing, and He remains faithful to me in every season.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So Joseph stayed in Egypt, along with all his father’s family. He lived a hundred and ten years.

declarations.text: I am made in God's image, reflecting His glory and goodness.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So God created mankind in his own image, in the image of God he created them; male and female he created them.

declarations.text: God has given me dominion over the earth to steward with wisdom.
declarations.bibleVerseText: God blessed them and said to them, 'Be fruitful and increase in number; fill the earth and subdue it. Rule over the fish in the sea and the birds in the sky and over every living creature that moves on the ground.'

declarations.text: I trust that God provides for all my needs.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Then God said, 'I give you every seed-bearing plant on the face of the whole earth and every tree that has fruit with seed in it. They will be yours for food.'

declarations.text: God has given me rest and peace in His creation.
declarations.bibleVerseText: By the seventh day God had finished the work he had been doing; so on the seventh day he rested from all his work.

declarations.text: I am created to work and cultivate the gifts God has given me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord God took the man and put him in the Garden of Eden to work it and take care of it.

declarations.text: God has blessed me to be a blessing to others.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I will make you into a great nation, and I will bless you; I will make your name great, and you will be a blessing.

declarations.text: God's promises to me are certain and true.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord had said to Abram, 'Go from your country, your people and your father’s household to the land I will show you.'

declarations.text: God is my protector and guide in every situation.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Do not be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your very great reward.

declarations.text: I am chosen and set apart by God for a purpose.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I will establish my covenant between me and you and your descendants after you throughout their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be God to you and to your offspring after you.

declarations.text: God's covenant with me is everlasting and unbreakable.
declarations.bibleVerseText: And I will give to you and to your offspring after you the land of your sojournings, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession, and I will be their God.

declarations.text: God listens to me and provides for my needs.
declarations.bibleVerseText: God heard the boy crying, and the angel of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, 'What is the matter, Hagar? Do not be afraid; God has heard the boy crying as he lies there.'

declarations.text: I am a friend of God, and He confides in me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord appeared to Abraham near the great trees of Mamre while he was sitting at the entrance to his tent in the heat of the day.

declarations.text: God's plan for me is to prosper and multiply.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I will make your descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky and will give them all these lands, and through your offspring all nations on earth will be blessed.

declarations.text: God is with me wherever I go.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I am with you and will watch over you wherever you go, and I will bring you back to this land. I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.

declarations.text: I am blessed by God, and my life is fruitful.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Then God blessed Noah and his sons, saying to them, 'Be fruitful and increase in number and fill the earth.'

declarations.text: God gives me the wisdom to make righteous decisions.
declarations.bibleVerseText: But the Lord was with Joseph and showed him steadfast love and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison.

declarations.text: God is my provider and sustainer in every season.
declarations.bibleVerseText: God said to Noah, 'This is the sign of the covenant I have established between me and all life on the earth.'

declarations.text: God has given me the ability to be a blessing in my family.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Isaac brought her into the tent of his mother Sarah, and he married Rebekah. So she became his wife, and he loved her; and Isaac was comforted after his mother’s death.

declarations.text: I walk in God's favor and receive His blessings.
declarations.bibleVerseText: And the Lord said to him, 'I am the Lord, who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans to give you this land to take possession of it.'

declarations.text: God’s promises to me are fulfilled, and I am blessed.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord was with Joseph so that he prospered, and he lived in the house of his Egyptian master.

declarations.text: God has a plan for my life that is good and full of hope.
declarations.bibleVerseText: But Joseph said to them, 'Don’t be afraid. Am I in the place of God? You intended to harm me, but God intended it for good to accomplish what is now being done, the saving of many lives.'

declarations.text: I am part of God’s great story and His eternal covenant.
declarations.bibleVerseText: And he blessed him and said, 'Blessed be Abram by God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth.'

declarations.text: God is faithful, and His promises to me never fail.
declarations.bibleVerseText: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to him and said, 'I am God Almighty; walk before me faithfully and be blameless.'

declarations.text: God’s presence is with me and brings me peace.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So Jacob called the place Peniel, saying, 'It is because I saw God face to face, and yet my life was spared.'

declarations.text: I trust that God’s promises to me will be fulfilled.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Then the Lord appeared to him and said, 'To your offspring I will give this land.'

declarations.text: God’s plans for my life are good and purposeful.
declarations.bibleVerseText: You intended to harm me, but God intended it for good to accomplish what is now being done, the saving of many lives.

declarations.text: God is with me in every challenge, bringing victory.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord was with Joseph, so he succeeded in everything he did as he served in the home of his Egyptian master.

declarations.text: I am blessed because God’s favor rests upon me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Isaac planted crops in that land and the same year reaped a hundredfold, because the Lord blessed him.

declarations.text: I am not alone; God is with me and guides my steps.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar and where you made a vow to me.

declarations.text: God’s protection surrounds me like a shield.
declarations.bibleVerseText: But God came to Abimelek in a dream one night and said to him, 'You are as good as dead because of the woman you have taken; she is a married woman.'

declarations.text: I am blessed and my family is blessed through me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: In your seed all the nations of the earth shall be blessed, because you have obeyed My voice.

declarations.text: God is my provider, and I lack nothing.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So Abraham called that place The Lord Will Provide. And to this day it is said, 'On the mountain of the Lord it will be provided.'

declarations.text: I walk in the promise and blessing of God daily.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I am God Almighty; be fruitful and increase in number. A nation and a community of nations will come from you, and kings will be among your descendants.

declarations.text: God is my help in times of trouble.
declarations.bibleVerseText: If the God of my father, the God of Abraham and the Fear of Isaac, had not been with me, you would surely have sent me away empty-handed.

declarations.text: I am fruitful because I abide in God’s blessing.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the earth.

declarations.text: God’s favor opens doors of opportunity for me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: But the Lord was with Joseph and showed him mercy, and He gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison.

declarations.text: God’s faithfulness to me is everlasting.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I will establish my covenant with you, and you will enter the ark—you and your sons and your wife and your sons’ wives with you.

declarations.text: I am chosen by God to fulfill His purpose.
declarations.bibleVerseText: And in you all the families of the earth shall be blessed.

declarations.text: God is my refuge and my strength.
declarations.bibleVerseText: After this, the word of the Lord came to Abram in a vision: 'Do not be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your very great reward.'

declarations.text: I receive God’s abundant grace and mercy.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord was with him; he showed him kindness and granted him favor in the eyes of the prison warden.

declarations.text: God’s plan for me is to prosper and not to harm me.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God he created him; male and female he created them.

declarations.text: God’s promises to me are unchanging and eternal.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I will establish my covenant as an everlasting covenant between me and you and your descendants after you for the generations to come.

declarations.text: I am led by God’s wisdom in every decision I make.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Pharaoh said to Joseph, 'I hereby put you in charge of the whole land of Egypt.'

declarations.text: God's creativity flows through me, and I am a creator.
declarations.bibleVerseText: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

declarations.text: I am made complete in God's image, lacking nothing.
declarations.bibleVerseText: God saw all that he had made, and it was very good.

declarations.text: God gives me dominion and authority over my life.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth.

declarations.text: God's presence is always with me, guiding my path.
declarations.bibleVerseText: And they heard the sound of the Lord God walking in the garden in the cool of the day.

declarations.text: I walk in the favor of God, just as Noah did.
declarations.bibleVerseText: But Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord.

declarations.text: God's plans for me are always for my good.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord regretted that he had made human beings on the earth, and his heart was deeply troubled.

declarations.text: God remembers me and shows me His faithfulness.
declarations.bibleVerseText: But God remembered Noah and all the wild animals and the livestock that were with him in the ark.

declarations.text: I am fruitful and multiply in all areas of my life.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Be fruitful and increase in number and fill the earth.

declarations.text: God’s promises bring me hope and a future.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I establish my covenant with you: Never again will all life be destroyed by the waters of a flood.

declarations.text: God guides me into new and prosperous lands.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord had said to Abram, 'Go from your country, your people and your father’s household to the land I will show you.'

declarations.text: I am called to be a blessing to others.
declarations.bibleVerseText: And all peoples on earth will be blessed through you.

declarations.text: God shields me and is my great reward.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Do not be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your very great reward.

declarations.text: God's promises to me are as numerous as the stars.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Look up at the sky and count the stars—if indeed you can count them. Then he said to him, 'So shall your offspring be.'

declarations.text: God gives me strength to overcome every challenge.
declarations.bibleVerseText: As for Ishmael, I have heard you: I will surely bless him; I will make him fruitful and will greatly increase his numbers.

declarations.text: I am obedient to God's call, and He blesses me abundantly.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So Abram went, as the Lord had told him; and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he set out from Harran.

declarations.text: God blesses my household with prosperity and peace.
declarations.bibleVerseText: From there he went on toward the hills east of Bethel and pitched his tent, with Bethel on the west and Ai on the east.

declarations.text: God fights my battles and brings me victory.
declarations.bibleVerseText: When Abram heard that his relative had been taken captive, he called out the 318 trained men born in his household and went in pursuit as far as Dan.

declarations.text: God’s faithfulness to me is unwavering.
declarations.bibleVerseText: I have sworn by myself, declares the Lord, that because you have done this and have not withheld your son, your only son.

declarations.text: I am a recipient of God's abundant provision.
declarations.bibleVerseText: Abraham looked up and there in a thicket he saw a ram caught by its horns. He went over and took the ram and sacrificed it as a burnt offering instead of his son.

declarations.text: God's love for me is deep and personal.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So she named the Lord who spoke to her: 'You are the God who sees me,' for she said, 'I have now seen the One who sees me.'

declarations.text: God is my deliverer and sets me free from every bondage.
declarations.bibleVerseText: So I have come down to rescue them from the hand of the Egyptians and to bring them up out of that land into a good and spacious land.

declarations.text: God loves me so much that He is always with me, guiding my path.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord went ahead of them; He guided them during the day with a pillar of cloud and provided light at night with a pillar of fire.

declarations.text: I am loved by God, who hears my prayers and delivers me from trouble.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord said, ‘I have indeed seen the misery of my people in Egypt. I have heard them crying out because of their slave drivers, and I am concerned about their suffering.’

declarations.text: God’s love for me is so great that He fights for me and gives me peace.
declarations.bibleVerseText: The Lord will fight for you; you need only to be still.

declarations.text: I am deeply loved by God, who calls me by name and knows me personally.
